title: Assistant Professor
biography: Tianyin Xu is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC), with a courtesy appointment in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. Before joining UIUC, he spent a year at Facebook's Core Systems, working on datacenter failures and eating free food. He received his PhD from the University of California San Diego, where he worked with his advisor, Professor Yuanyuan Zhou. He has also worked with NetApp and Whova, and backpacked Europe for 1.5 years before starting his graduate studies.

professionalHighlights.organization: The Grainger College of Engineering's 2024 Dean’s Award for Excellence in Research for Assistant Professor

researchStatement: The goal of my research is to make computer systems reliable and secure, especially those operating at the cloud and datacenter scale. My mission is to help today's systems defend against all kinds of errors and defects, such as software bugs, configuration errors, and design flaws. I am very happy that some of our work helps improve the reliability of real-world systems.

researchInterests.area: Reliability and Security of Cloud-Scale Systems
researchInterests.description: Building systems that can defend against various types of errors and defects, including software bugs, configuration errors, and design flaws.
Developing techniques to manage and validate system configurations to ensure reliability and security.
Applying formal methods to verify the correctness of system components and interactions.
Developing tools and techniques for automatic end-to-end testing of large-scale cloud systems, such as Acto.

researchAreas: Programming Languages / Formal Methods / Software Engineering
